title: Integrated Social-Emotional Learning (SEL) and Data-Informed Learning Design (DILD) Training Program for Pre-Service Teachers

context.prior_knowledge: General foundational pedagogy knowledge, understanding of Social-Emotional Learning (SEL) concepts, and basic data interpretation skills
context.additional_context: A case-based training and data analysis integrated curriculum for pre-service teachers to effectively apply SEL (Social-Emotional Learning) elements in future classrooms.

learning_goals: Learners can explain the five core competencies of SEL (self-awareness, self-management, social awareness, relationship skills, and responsible decision-making).
Learners can diagnose learners' socioemotional needs by analyzing simple survey data.
Learners can design SEL-integrated lesson plans based on the DILD framework and incorporate peer feedback.
Learners can propose methods to implement SEL-related educational activities using only a smartphone in offline environments.

resources: SEL case study video (for smartphone playback)
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
